fields.description:
To replicate:

1. Log out
2. Paste a URL which is not accessible into your browser -- you go to the login page
3. Log in as a user who cannot see that URL -- you stay at the login page
4. Go to the dashboard -- you go to the dashboard
5. Log out
6. Log in -- you stay on the login page, with a message stating that you can't see the original URL

JIRA doesn't have this problem -- it passes redirect URLs as parameters on requests instead of storing them in the session
fields.summary: Once Seraph redirects a user, that user cannot log in without being redirected again

fields.description:

fields.description:
If you have a component in an uploaded plugin, and you uninstall the plugin, recompile the plugin and upload it again, you'll get errors whenever the component is accessed. I'm guessing it's because the old object (and thus, the old class) is still in memory as a component. This may be impossible to get around, but if you could, it would make developing plugins with components much faster, since I currently have to bounce the server to get stuff working again, which kind of defeats the purpose of uploaded plugins...

Here's the error. Hope it's helpful...

fields.description:
The labels -> content link table should include (possibly using ConfluenceEntityObject properties:

* Who labeled the content (lastModifierName?)
* When the label was applied (lastModificationDate?)
* Space key to which the label was applied (may be null)

Rather than have lots of different classes of labels, the label table should store prefix and labelname (so my:favourite has prefix 'my') and we do label type lookups by distinguishing on prefix.
fields.summary: New model for labels

fields.description:
When starting up the standalone 1.4.3 version, during the upgrade, it fails during DuplicateNotificationsCleanupUpgradeTask. MySQL complains about syntax error with one of the SQLs being run. I believe the SQL is:

select grouped_data.PAGEID, grouped_data.SPACEID, grouped_data.USERNAME from (   select count(*) as NOTIF_COUNT, PAGEID, SPACEID, lower(USERNAME) as USERNAME    from NOTIFICATIONS    group by lower(USERNAME), PAGEID, SPACEID ) grouped_data where grouped_data.NOTIF_COUNT > 1

At the very least, please test your upgrades on MySQL which is probably the most common db used for Confluence.
fields.summary: SQL run by DuplicateNotificationsCleanupUpgradeTask gives syntax error on MySQL

fields.description: The {jiraissues} macro is very useful but the need to embed user authentication information (the password) in the URL renders it virtually unusable.   It would be nice to allow you to only specify the username if you've integrated your JIRA/Confluence installs.
fields.summary: Use {jiraissues} macro w/o full login info

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add a couple of new events into the mix? Specifially, it would be good to have an event sent after all macros, components, auto-wiring and all the rest of that stuff has been completed, and Confluence is ready to start responding to requests. That would allow me to do any initialisation in my components knowing that all my autowired links are set and the system is ready to go. Also, on a related note, it would be good to know when confluence is shutting down (if possible - I know it may not actually get any warning...) so that any cleanup can be done. The startup one is the main issue right now though.

Thanks again...
fields.summary: New events: ConfluenceStartedEvent and ConfluenceStoppingEvent

fields.description:
To replicate:

1. Find a page that requires a login to access
2. View the page attachments and copy the URL (should be something like: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=12345)
3. Log out, and return to that URL

You should be presented with "Page Not Found", when a more appropriate response would be asking for a login - or [if logged in] telling them that they dont have the required security access (as that page id does exist, it just is not accessible with your current security privs).
fields.summary: Restricted page attachments when logged out gives page not found not login required

fields.description:
Encountered a problem with spaces pages delivered over SSL never finishing the page load and discovered the following:

When viewing SSL spaces pages rendered from the default URL format: 

https://<server>:8443/display/<space>/<page>

using the standalone version of Confluence with an SSL connector enabled, the page does not stop loading until the timeout occurs for the SSL connector in server.xml.  This was confirmed by adding a timeout in server.xml to the SSL connector, similar to the non-SSL connector.

This only appears to happen when viewing pages in spaces with the default URL format.  When using the short form URL for a page, for example, this does not appear to happen.
fields.summary: In standalone version, spaces pages delivered over HTTPS never finish loading until connection timeout is reached.

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4010].
  {panel}

At present, you can only really get to a news page by it's date. The fact that news pages are so different to normal pages can be confusing for many users (eg. the question keeps getting asked: "how to i create a link to my news page") - people expect linking to a news page to be the same as linking to a normal page (eg. via title).

Could news pages be perfectly normal pages but with a label of "news" in 1.5?

If so, you could then choose which labels would show the calendar - eg. you might want "annoucements" and "news" to show the calendar.

News pages, now being normal pages with a set label, could be linked to like everything else.

When putting in a date URL it would simply list all pages who's label is set to associate them with a calendar (unless specifying a specific label in the URL in which case it would list all pages with that label on that date regardless of whether they are associated with a calendar).

This would, for example, allow you to browse changes to a site using the calendar - you'd see on the calendar when pages where changed, click the date and it would show or list the pages for that date.

Although this idea is embryonic, I tink it would help standardise the way everything works and add lots of flexibility if further developed.

Any comments?
fields.summary: Make news posts simply labelled pages and allow all pages to be accessed by date
Allow escaping of special characters (e.g. pipe '|', backslash '\' and braces '}') in macro parameters for regular expressions, links, etc.

The AbstractHttpRetrievalMacro uses the HttpClient package to handle the html retrieval.

This client currently does not handle the http.nonProxyHost property. We need to support this property, so either implement this and send a patch to jakarta or find a new package.
fields.summary: support -Dhttp.nonProxyHost setting

fields.description:
On the 'Info' tab of each page it lists the permissions set on that page and it's parent. When reporting on it's parents, it looks like this:

Restrictions from parent pages:
   [Page Name] - only [username] can edit this page.

The confusion arises from the "Restrictions from parent pages" text. It gives the impression that the restrictions applying to the parent page are also applying to this page. This does not actually appear to hapen. So either there is a problem with permissions, or the text should be changed to something like "Restrictions that apply to parent pages:"

Actually, I'm not even sure why this is useful information. If permissions don't apply down the page tree, why do I care what the permissions are on my parent pages? It has absolutely no effect on the page I'm viewing...
fields.summary: Page permission info is misleading

fields.description: The default templates add "Confluence" on to every page title.  Since there are many influential open source sites using Confluence for public sites, it makes it really hard to Google for "Confluence" and get results that are actually related to Confluence the product.  That, in turn, makes it hard to track down other Confluence users, Google for solutions to Confluence problems, seek out third party macros, etc.  To be sure, all of the above can be accomplished through various Atlassian sites, but sometimes it's nice to be able to cast the net wider.
fields.summary: Remove "Confluence" from default page title

fields.description: When uploading a file, we currently load it into memory. We should be writing it directly to disk to avoid memory issues.
fields.summary: Reduce memory footprint of file-upload by writing uploaded file directly to disk

fields.description:
If you write a macro which returns null from the getRenderMode() method, the documentation says the rendering engine will expect wiki text back from the execute() method and will render it after calling execute(). This is basically true, except that any macros in the returned text will _not_ be rendered - they will just be output, {}'s and all.

As a workaround, you can return text which has had just the macros rendered, but I'm not sure if this is a safe thing to do, since many macros will return XHTML, and I have no idea what will happen when that gets passed through the engine...
fields.summary: getRenderMode() returning null does not render contained macros

fields.description:
If you have a page with user profile links and you move that page to another space, it will have the old space name prefixed after being moved. For example, if you have a page in 'OLDSPACE' called 'Test Page' containing the following:

[~username]

You then move it to 'NEWSPACE', and it will now contain the following:

[OLDSPACE:~username]

Not very helpful...
fields.summary: User profile links are incorrectly prefixed with the old space name when a page is moved.

fields.description:
We've been creating pages with default open permissions (CONF-3991). This is not good.

We need a tool that will set all page permissions to the space default.

It might also be good to have a report that would generate a list of pages that have permissions different that the space default (and have that mailable).
fields.summary: Space Permissions fixer

fields.description:
We've been creating pages with default open permissions (CONF-3991). This is not good.

We need a tool that will set all page permissions to the space default.

It might also be good to have a report that would generate a list of pages that have permissions different that the space default (and have that mailable).
fields.summary: Space Permissions fixer

fields.description:
I created a page in my personal space which has permissions set so that only I can view. 
No anonymous permissions set.
Menu needs to be 
Permissions set to Space default
Checkbox to override permissions, which would activate the permissions menu, and let the user set the permissions.

I've always noticed that when creating a page, that open permissions were set, but thought that space permissions would be enforced.

I created a page. Then logged in as the administrative users (if you use root all the time, you'll never know what problems users are having ). I then when to the dashboard, and noticed that my page was in the recently updated. How could this be, I set up the space with permissions so that only i could view it.
I logged out, and logged in as myself, and reset the permissions to myself only, and

Then I thought, oh crap (to put it lightly). All those pages we've created since the 1.4 upgrade have open permissions, and anyone can read them. That is really not a good thing to find out on saturday morning.
(explicative) I need to file two issues, one fix the interface, one make a space permissions fixer.
fields.summary: Page Permissions should reflect space permission when creating a page

fields.description:
From David Peterson on Conf-User:

When converting WYSIWYG content into Wiki content, put some optional whitespace back into it for readability. The main ones I would suggest at this point are putting a blank line in front of any headings (makes it easer to see sections in the page), and put a single space around table cell content (makes it easier to see where cells are divided). Eg instead of having:

h1. Main Point
h2. Sub Point
||One||Two||
|Three|Four|

...have this:

h1. Main Point

h2. Sub Point
|| One || Two ||
| Three | Four |
fields.summary: Introduce whitespace into wiki text for readability where possible

fields.description:
It would be great if there was a way to be notified when an attachment is viewed. Viewing could happen when it is clicked on and downloaded, or it could be when an attached image is loaded on a page (eg. '!image.jpg!). Basically, any time the attachment is served from Confluence.

This would make it possible to write an plug in which, for example, tracked the number of times a particular file was downloaded. A complementing macro could then report that statistic on a page somewhere.
fields.summary: AttachmentViewEvent

fields.description: No '#addcomment' or '#comments' anchors are being generated when viewing comments on pages. As a result, clicking 'View comments' or 'Add comment' doesn't scroll down to the appropriate part of the page when clicked.
fields.summary: Missing #comments and #addcomment anchors when viewing page

fields.description:
It would be nice if Confluenc would respect the JAVA_OPTS flags that JIRA does to make it easier to restore a full production image and run as a test server.
-Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true 
-Datlassian.mail.popdisabled=true

A workaround I use is to
1) automatically shutdown the server before midnight to present emails going out
2) change the job scheduling file WEB-INF/classes/schedulingSubsystemContext.xml to change the timing of mailPollTrigger to something that will not occur
fields.summary: Support mail disable switches

fields.description:
In general, the performance of 1.4.4 is a bit on the slow side. Things are ok when we are getting cache hits - but when we have to go to the databse, we really notice the slowness.

Looking at the database performance in a bit more detail, we have spotted a couple of issues so far.

Two cuprits so far are:
============================================================
SELECT   contentent0_.contentid AS x0_0_
    FROM content contentent0_
   WHERE (contentent0_.prevver IS NULL)
     AND (contentent0_.content_status = 'current')
     AND (contentent0_.contenttype != 'MAIL')
     AND (contentent0_.contenttype != 'SPACEDESCRIPTION')
ORDER BY contentent0_.lastmoddate DESC
============================================================
This one results in a full table scan.
Trouble is that all of the columns here have very poor selectivity.
We will look at trying to use a bitmapped index... let you know how we go....


The other one we have spotted so far is a bit nasty
============================================================
SELECT *
  FROM (SELECT   content.contentid AS contentid0_,
                 content.contenttype AS contentt2_0_,
                 content.title AS title0_, content.BODY AS body0_,
                 content.VERSION AS version0_, content.creator AS creator0_,
                 content.creationdate AS creation7_0_,
                 content.lastmodifier AS lastmodi8_0_,
                 content.lastmoddate AS lastmodd9_0_,
                 content.prevver AS prevver0_,
                 content.content_status AS content11_0_,
                 content.spaceid AS spaceid0_, content.parentid AS parentid0_,
                 content.blogspaceid AS blogspa14_0_,
                 content.descspaceid AS descspa15_0_,
                 content.pageid AS pageid0_,
                 content.parentcommentid AS parentc17_0_,
                 content.username AS username0_,
                 content.messageid AS messageid0_,
                 content.mailspaceid AS mailspa20_0_
            FROM content content INNER JOIN content b ON (    content.pageid =
                                                                   b.contentid
                                                          AND (   b.spaceid =
                                                                            :1
                                                               OR b.blogspaceid =
                                                                            :2
                                                              )
                                                          AND (   b.contenttype =
                                                                        'PAGE'
                                                               OR b.contenttype =
                                                                     'BLOGPOST'
                                                              )
                                                          AND b.content_status =
                                                                     'current'
                                                         )
           WHERE content.contenttype = 'COMMENT'
        ORDER BY content.lastmoddate DESC)
 WHERE ROWNUM <= :3
============================================================

Very sketchy information so far.... 
I will post it here as it comes to hand.

In the case of the thread-dump below, I tried re-indexing - and it seemed to never come back...
I have seen this deadlock before with confl 1.4.3 - but it was unrelated to the indexing - so I am going to have to chase it down.

fields.summary: Missing image in Full Notation Guide

fields.description:
We have a default logo for the space, but some spaces want to have no logo.

I guess we could have a 1x1 transparent logo... but it would be better to have a "None" option at the server and space level.
fields.summary: No way to set "No Logo" at space level

Similar error can be re-created by trying to edit http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Versioning+of+dynamic+content

Tried to add page.   Was in rich editor, typed in stuff including excerpt macro.  Had problems creating.  Couldn't switch to wiki market - gave error.  Eventually added page using regular wiki editor.  Now can't go back and update it.

500 Internal Server Error
JTidy rejected the rendered xhtml:
Discuss versioning of data in confluence 
Versioning dynamic content
The version support for regular pages is an extremely important feature. What about versioning of dynmic content? Confluence has many capabilities that allow for content to be dynamically generated using scripts, sql, scaffold macro, dynamic tasklist, etc... Confluence nicely versions the pages of scripts. Can it be modified to allow the capture of a version of result of viewing the page? Could this be done on demand - take a snapshot now? Could this be done via a program or scheduled - like take a snapshot every morning at 7:00. Each snapshot would be a version of the dynamic content of the page and treated similar to a regular page version. This would be a powerful capability and more extensive use of capabilities like the scaffold macro (one of the drawbacks of this is that there is no history of what happened on the page).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3964].
  {panel}

We should keep hit statistics. 
Every day we should package them up into summaries - hits per content, edits per content.
(Every week package the days into weekly summaries, ditto months?)

This lets people track which bits of their site are visited/never visited, etc.

Live statistics would be flashy, but daily digests would solve 99% of the problem.
